bullkpy.pp#

.. py:module:: bullkpy.pp


.. py:function:: qc_metrics(adata, *, layer='counts', mt_prefix='MT-', mt_var_key=None, detection_threshold=0.0, compute_total_counts=True, compute_n_genes=True, compute_pct_mt=True)
   :module: bullkpy.pp

   Compute bulk QC metrics in adata.obs.

   :rtype: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:obj\:\`None\``

   Smart behavior:
     - If `layer` looks like raw counts: compute total_counts, n_genes_detected, pct_counts_mt
     - If `layer` looks non-integer (log/normalized): compute only n_genes_detected using `detection_threshold`


.. py:function:: set_raw_counts(adata, *, layer='counts', overwrite=False)
   :module: bullkpy.pp

   Store current adata.X into adata.layers[layer] as raw counts.

   Call this once right after reading counts (before any normalization).


   :rtype: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:obj\:\`None\``


.. py:function:: normalize_cpm(adata, *, layer='counts', target_sum=1000000.0, out_layer='cpm', inplace_X=False, eps=1e-12)
   :module: bullkpy.pp

   CPM normalize counts per sample.

   :type layer: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`str\` \| \:py\:obj\:\`None\``
   :param layer: Input layer. If None, uses adata.X.
   :type target_sum: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`float\``
   :param target_sum: Scale factor (1e6 = CPM).
   :type out_layer: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`str\``
   :param out_layer: Where to write normalized values (adata.layers[out_layer]).
   :type inplace_X: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`bool\``
   :param inplace_X: If True, also write normalized values into adata.X.
   :type eps: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`float\``
   :param eps: Small constant to avoid division by zero.

   :rtype: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:obj\:\`None\``


.. py:function:: log1p(adata, *, layer='cpm', out_layer='log1p_cpm', inplace_X=False)
   :module: bullkpy.pp

   log1p-transform a layer (default: CPM) and store as a new layer.

   Works with dense or sparse matrices.


   :rtype: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:obj\:\`None\``


.. py:function:: highly_variable_genes(adata, *, layer='log1p_cpm', n_top_genes=2000, n_bins=20, min_mean=0.0, max_mean=inf, min_disp=-inf, key_added='highly_variable')
   :module: bullkpy.pp

   Select highly variable genes (bulk-friendly version of HVGs).

   This computes mean and variance across samples on the chosen layer
   and identifies genes with high dispersion relative to genes of similar mean
   (mean-binned z-score of log-dispersion, Scanpy/Seurat spirit).

   :rtype: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:obj\:\`None\``

   Stores results in `adata.var`:
     - mean, variance, dispersion, dispersion_norm
     - boolean flag `adata.var[key_added]` (default: 'highly_variable')


.. py:function:: filter_genes(adata, *, layer='counts', min_samples=3, min_expr=0.0, inplace=True)
   :module: bullkpy.pp

   Filter genes by detection across samples.

   A gene is "detected" in a sample if expression > min_expr in `layer`.
   Keeps genes detected in at least `min_samples` samples.

   Works for counts (min_expr=0) or log layers (use e.g. min_expr=0.1).


   :rtype: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`\~anndata.\_core.anndata.AnnData\``


.. py:function:: filter_samples(adata, *, min_genes=None, min_counts=None, max_pct_mt=None, max_pct_ribo=None, layer='counts', expr_threshold_for_genes=0.0, mt_var_key=None, ribo_var_key=None, inplace=True)
   :module: bullkpy.pp

   Filter samples using QC metrics in `adata.obs` if present; otherwise compute from matrix.

   :rtype: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`\~anndata.\_core.anndata.AnnData\``

   No hard requirement that any of these columns exist:
     - total_counts
     - n_genes_detected
     - pct_counts_mt
     - pct_counts_ribo

   If a requested threshold is provided but cannot be computed, it will be skipped with a warning.


.. py:function:: batch_correct_combat(adata, *, batch_key, layer='log1p_cpm', covariates=None, key_added='combat', overwrite=False, inplace=True)
   :module: bullkpy.pp

   ComBat batch correction (Johnson et al.) for bulk expression.

   .. rubric:: Notes

   - ComBat is intended for approximately Gaussian data:
     use log-transformed normalized expression (e.g., log1p_cpm), not raw counts.
   - Writes corrected matrix to `adata.layers[key_added]` by default.

   :type batch_key: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`str\``
   :param batch_key: adata.obs column with batch labels (categorical recommended).
   :type layer: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`str\` \| \:py\:obj\:\`None\``
   :param layer: Which matrix to correct. If None, uses adata.X.
   :type covariates: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:data\:\`\~typing.Optional\`\\ \\\[\:py\:class\:\`\~typing.Sequence\`\\ \\\[\:py\:class\:\`str\`\]\]`
   :param covariates: Optional adata.obs columns to include in the design (biological covariates to preserve).
   :type key_added: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`str\``
   :param key_added: Layer name to store corrected values (if overwrite=False).
   :type overwrite: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`bool\``
   :param overwrite: If True, write corrected values back into the selected layer / X.
   :type inplace: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`bool\``
   :param inplace: If True, store results in adata; if False, return corrected matrix (samples x genes).

   :rtype: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:`\:py\:class\:\`\~numpy.ndarray\` \| \:py\:obj\:\`None\``
